VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Product List Page

The Product List page shows a list of products that belong to a selected category or that match a user's search query. B2B Commerce for Visualforce references the most recently built product index records for quickly serving results. The Product List page displays only the products that the current storefront user is entitled to view.

REQUIRED EDITIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)
USER EXPERIENCE COMPATIBILITY
Interface	Bootstrap 3 only
User visibility	Logged-in users and guest users (depending on your storefront's guest user access)
NOTE
Version 2.0 of the Product List page replaced the legacy version 1.0 in B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9). For better performance, easier extension, and ongoing support, we recommend that new implementations always use version 2.0. If necessary for compatibility purposes, you can optionally re-enable version 1.0.
The information in these help topics applies only to Product List page version 2.0.
Configure the Layout Options Available for the Product List Page
Equip buyers with tools for personalizing their experience when browsing the Product List page. Admins can enforce a default user experience for buyers, and determine which options are available on the page for buyers to customize the experience.
Configure the Sort Options Available for the Product List Page
Give buyers flexibility for discovering all products that belong to a specific category or that match their search query. Specify which options and criteria are available on the Product List page for sorting the results, and enforce a default sort behavior.
Factors That Affect Sorting by Price on the Product List Page
Prices that buyers see on your storefront depend on several data sources and buyer experience decisions, which can complicate the task of sorting products by price. Consider the buyer's entitlements, the buyer's selected Product List page options, and the configuration settings you specify for the Product List page experience. When a buyer sorts results on the Product List page by price, B2B Commerce for Visualforce evaluates these different factors to make sure that results sort correctly.
Adjust Criteria for Ranking Storefront Search Results
To control how B2B Commerce for Visualforce ranks results from a search on your storefront, you can adjust the importance of certain criteria. You can specify how important matching a product name, short description, or SKU influences the order of results.
Specify Extra Results Buffer for the Product List Page
You can specify a quantity of extra products to sort on the Product List page, in addition to the selected Page Size layout option. The extra number of products serves as a buffer, which helps prevent potential user experience disruptions that can result from pricing and sorting configurations.
Show the Total Number of Products on the Product List Page
Set expectations for a buyer browsing your Product List page by showing the total number of products that match the selected category or search query.
Show Subcategory Details on the Product List Page
Help buyers navigate your product taxonomy with clarity by showing more information about selected categories and their subcategories on the Product List page.
Configure Product Tile Details and Options on the Product List Page
Each product shown on the Product List page can include a subset of product information and buttons for adding the product to a cart or wishlist. All the details and options that pertain to a single product comprise a product tile. To help entice buyers to view and purchase products, you can specify which details and options you want to be available on each product tile.
Customize the Search Results Text on the Product List Page
Replace the default text that displays on the Product List page for search results.
Extension Points for the Product List Page
To modify the default behavior for how the Product List page populates data for entitled products, extend or override the appropriate API classes and methods.
